revised_title: Remembering the Fellows: A Tribute to the Royal Society Members
tldr: The author, Sir Henry Dale, pays tribute to the Royal Society members who passed away since the last Anniversary Meeting. The article highlights the lives and achievements of notable scientists, including Duke of Connaught, Emile Picard, Tullio Levi-Civita, Earl of Berkeley, William Henry Bragg, Jean Perrin, George Gerald Stony, Joseph Larmor, and Andrew Russell Forsyth. These individuals made significant contributions to various fields of science, such as mathematics, physics, and engineering.
scientific_discipline: Social Sciences, Art, and Humanities > History of Science
